meanings.definition: Instigate or stir up (an undesirable or violent sentiment or course of action)
meanings.sent1: The angry speech foments unrest among the crowd.
meanings.sent2: His reckless behavior foments trouble wherever he goes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey foments chaos in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her words fomented a storm of emotions within him.
meanings.sent5: The rumor quickly foments fear in the small town.

meanings.definition: Promote the development of (something undesirable or violent)
meanings.sent1: The negative comments fomented more arguments in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive marketing campaign foments hostility among competitors.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food foments a riot in my stomach.
meanings.sent4: The harsh policies fomented discontent among the employees.
meanings.sent5: The harsh weather conditions fomented chaos in the city.

meanings.sent1: The corrupt leader foments rebellion among the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment of workers foments strikes in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child foments mischief wherever he goes.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive regime foments dissent among the population.
meanings.sent5: The harsh living conditions fomented unrest in the community.
